Reviews.Title: Excellent camera!
Reviews.Author: Yarii
Reviews.Content: NOTE:  I own this camera in silver, but the features are the same as the blue color.Let me tell you what a great camera this is - for the low price Amazon is charging you absolutely cannot go wrong choosing this one. It's on special for the Holidays but even if it goes up in price a little afterward, it's still a bargain for the features you get. The camera may be plastic, but it's a high-quality plastic with raised lettering, the build quality is excellent as well as the fit & finish, and the sharpness of the LCD is as good as I've seen on expensive cameras.I own a Panasonic DMC-TZ4 which cost well over $250 two years ago, and this is just as good, if not better, than my TZ4 which I still use, I just don't carry it in my bag as it's too heavy. This camera is light-weight and easy to toss in a bag, but I do recommend a case. It keeps your camera looking nice.One thing I want you to note if you don't get anything else from reading my review - the best way to keep your camera from getting a zoom error is to flick the switch on the back to the VIEW images side (green arrow); that way if your camera accidentally gets turned on in your bag, the lens will not open and zoom out. Not all cameras have the slide switch, but all the Panasonic cameras I'm aware of, do have the same type switch.OK, back to the camera. One thing I like about the LCD screen on this camera is you have a high-angle view choice. This comes in handy at parades when all the tall people are standing in front of you; all you do is hold your arms up over your head and you can still see what you are shooting at down below.The camera turns on fast, shoots fast, and recovers to take another shot the fastest of any camera I've ever used, and I've used many. This camera has MEGA Optical Image Stabilization, which is hard to find at this price. The lithium-ion battery life is excellent, I've shot over 250 pics and movies and it has not needed recharging. The battery charger comes with the camera, and will charge a dead battery in 90 minutes. Naturally, it also comes with the USB cable, photo-editing software which I don't care for and is not worth installing, and the A/V cable to plug into your TV for viewing photos & videos that way. BTW, A/V cables aren't being included in the lower-end cameras much anymore, but this camera does have them.Most of the time I leave it on the Intelligent Autofocus (IA) - this dedicated button is located on the top to the right of the shutter release - you can push and go from any other mode to this in an instant - this will let the camera choose on its own any of 6 different scenes so you don't have to decide yourself. I also like the regular scene modes - one of them you can make yourself skinnier. :) Another scene selection you can choose one of 3 frames to automatically surround your picture. Yet another you have a choice of Baby 1 or Baby 2 where you can also add name and age.One of the scene settings is called Flash Burst, where you can take 5 consecutive pics with flash by holding the shutter down; this is a great feature to have if you have a moving object such as a child or pet as you are bound to get at least one good shot out of the five.Picture quality is excellent. I've taken quite a few shots of my cats (on the pet scene mode) and when enlarged to full screen-view size on my 22" monitor, I can see every strand of fur in great detail.One thing I find to be cute and I've never seen it before: the little green dot that comes on to show you are focused can be changed from a plain green dot to a heart, a flower, or even a car among other things. So this may appeal to the younger photographers too.The HD movie quality is excellent, even better than my Flip MinoHD 2nd generation. The only downfall of the HD movie is the QuickTime format which this camera uses, is an SD card HOG. I recommend getting a minimum of a 16 GB SDHC CLASS 6 memory card if you plan on taking a lot of HD movies. If you are just primarily taking photos, a 2 GB or 4 GB card will do fine and they are fairly inexpensive. And no, you cannot zoom in and out while making a movie. You can set the zoom before you press the button, but not during.This camera case is a perfect fit: Lowepro Volta 20 Camera Case (Black)

Reviews.Title: Nice camera and a bargain also
Reviews.Author: J. Pfeister
Reviews.Content: I have been pleased with the Panasonic Lumix DMC-FH1.  I have also purchased an 8GB SD card to use with it so I would not run out of storage space in a normal day of vacationing.  It is a little larger in size than my Canon Power Shot SD1100 IS but it will still fit in your jeans pocket so you don't have to carry around a camera bag.  The view screen is about as large as would fit on the camera.  Because it is a 12mb camera, you can do a lot of cropping and still end up with a printable picture.  The best thing I can say about the Panasonic Lumix DMC-FH1 is that I would buy it again for myself and recommend to my friends.  The Amazon's price is right on this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera, "Why pay more?"
Reviews.Author: Raymond F. Hendrix
Reviews.Content: I am really impressed with this camera. I had a more expensive Canon that I was replacing after it was damaged and I was expecting an inferior camera because of the price. Also I was not very familiar with the Panasonic line of cameras. My wife convinced me to buy this one after we reviewed the specs and reviews (most on other variations of this basic version i.e., FH1-20). Because of our budget we opted for this model and were we surprised by it's performance and quality! The lower number of pixels is really not a disadvantage unless you are planning to make large posters and the advantages are, more pictures on the battery and a few other things (more pictures per second in Burst mode for example). The camera is simple to use but it also has advanced features that enable you to take sunset views, action shots, close ups, bright back lighting conditions etc. etc.My first shot after I opened the box was of a rotating ceiling fan with the light on. What a beautiful photo! The next one was of a close up of a page in the instruction manual. Another crystal clear image. If you happen to get a poor image just search the advanced instruction manual (on supplied CD) and you will find how to do it better next time. Or, if you are lazy, just use the Auto Mode on all your shots and I assure you that you will not be displeased with the results except in unusual conditions.If you decide to buy an extra battery from Amazon it will be more powerful than the one supplied and you will get more photos per charge but the one included is adequate. Some memory is built into the camera but I advise that you buy a memory card to supplement it. By the way the camera takes great movies too. With the 8 GB card I purchased I can take 8 minute clips (I am not sure if the card or the camera is the limiting factor).All in all I can only say, "Why pay more?".

Reviews.Title: Great over all camera
Reviews.Author: Luke skywalker
Reviews.Content: This Camera takes really good pictures over all. It's not really the best at night pictures. Used this camera in NYC at night and it took alright pictures, really was not super impressed. For this price range of camera I would say it's a very good buy!

Reviews.Title: Happy with purchse!
Reviews.Author: Edwin Rubio
Reviews.Content: I made an extensive deep research on all the point and shoot cameras under $200 and i even visited a couple of stores in my area, but this camera always won in comparison in price range. Picture is excellent, shutter speed is fast, zoom is great and price excellent for $89. Anything under $100 buy it is a great camera.Check the other reviews blue is hot. my opinion might be subjective but others say the same so i recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Iriemon
Reviews.Content: I'll echo the reviews of the others.  For the price, this is a great little camera.  It takes great pictures in various conditions, autofocus works well, it's pretty fast for image taking, and the HD video it takes (you need a SD6 card) actually looks great.  You can't go wrong with this one if you are looking for an inexpensive camera.

Reviews.Title: Almost Perfect!
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: I just received this camera and it works great.  Pictures look fantastic, transfer to your computer fairly easily.  The only flaw I have with this product is that the software that comes with the camera is not compatible with MACs and I can not find the software online for this camera for the MAC.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: m christy gardner
Reviews.Content: this has been a good camera and was a good value. but. customer service was very hard to deal with. takes good quality shots and is a good size.

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera
Reviews.Author: mariajoselucena
Reviews.Content: in my opinion, it is an amazing point and shoot camera.Good quality, and still being like that after one year. Good for Panasonic

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: yitzf
Reviews.Content: I purchased 3 cameras - the picture quality is amayzing and so are the videos - very easy to operatethe only issue you have is at night or during the day with direct sun or light it makes a line on the dispaly (known problem) - the line does not show up in the pictures but it does show in the video'syou simply have to avoid direct light - (not always possible)but it is defenitaly good value for the money

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera, Amazing Price!
Reviews.Author: E. Klemm
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a nice digital camera for my mom that was easy to use, not too fancy, not too hard on my pocketbook, but still good quality. I ended up ordering 2 of these, one for my mom and one for myself. I LOVE this camera. I have a big Sony A200, but wanted a small camera for my purse and this is it. The picture quality is really good and I was even more impressed with the video quality. I didn't know it took video when I ordered it. Great and easy to use (for my mom), but you can customize a lot of things at the same time (for me). I also love how the battery comes with a small charger that plugs right into the wall and I don't have to worry about rechargeable AA batteries. Love, love, love this camera. The blue is really fun too.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures, little blurry though
Reviews.Author: Trevor C. Morgan
Reviews.Content: Takes great pics and video, in HD. Camera has many different options. I would recommend using the Intelligent Auto every time though. Before I found this button, every picture was blurry. It was really hard to get any crisp pics without it on. Now they are all turning out great. I would definitely recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Just OK
Reviews.Author: gaf
Reviews.Content: We have the Panasonic  Lumix DMC-FZ28K 10MP Digital Camera with 18x Wide Angle MEGA Optical Image Stabilized Zoom (Black)and are very happy with it, but we wanted a second camera that was easier to carry around. The FZ28 was bulky so we were looking for one that was pocket-sized. We went with the Panasonic brand because of our experience with the FZ28. When the FH1 was being sold under $100, we got it. Pictures and videos are just okay, nothing great. Not bad, but could be better. Images were crisper with the FZ28. It's okay for everyday use, but for special occasions, we will still be using the reliable FZ28.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Little Camera
Reviews.Author: T.S.
Reviews.Content: We purchased several cameras and returned them before finding this gem.  Don't be fooled by other cameras offering more megapixels but inferior lenses and sensors. Even on full auto point-n-shoot mode or the many presets, this camera takes very good quality pictures. At full zoom pictures aren't grainy or indistinguishable as they were with other cameras we tried.  White balance is good - no orange people unless they over did it in the tanning beds.  Love the 5cm macro.  When you don't want to lug around your anti-tank DSLR, this Panasonic Lumix is a great choice.  If you're not used to small cameras, it'll take a little getting used to.  Good weight - feels perfect in your hands.  Nice metal body.  Great colors.  Wish it had a little more zoom, though.

Reviews.Title: Expected more from pictures quality
Reviews.Author: Disassembler
Reviews.Content: Ok, I expected a litle bit more from the pictures quality, it's, in fact, quite poor. The main problem is auto exposition errors, also it's gets pictures on high iso's when it's not necessary, so you got dark grain pictures in the perfect sunny conditions. It occurs not every time but quite often. I had very old and cheap camera - Nikon Coolpix 4600 and it makes pictures better.Vide is not bad for the price, better than I expected.Good accumulator, works long. Also it qorks quite fast, looks good.So, it's probably worth it's price if it does pictures better.

Reviews.Title: Die hard Panasonic fan
Reviews.Author: lovetoshop "lovetoshop"
Reviews.Content: I have owned a Panasonic since 2004 and love that camera, last month while taking it out of closet, I bumped it against the wall and now the lens is stuck. So I had to buy another camera that was small enough to fit in my purse because the first one had 12x zoom it was as big as an SLR. Long story short, after doing a lot of research and reading reviews on numerous sites, I decided to buy this camera because it was on sale and I didn't want to buy other brands. I have been pleased with the results. For a camera that cost less than $100, since it was on sale, pix are great and shutter speed has improved also from the old Panasonic that I had. Just to compare, I got Nikon coolpix S3000 also since people keep praising Nikon and the shutter speed was painfully slow and the picture quality didn't even come close to the one that this camera had. This baby is small and lightweight though the battery life is not that great when compared to my 6 yr old Panasonic, the reason could be that this doesn't have a view finder so the lcd screen is always on. It'd be better to keep an extra battery handy. I am not a professional but I love taking pics of various objects and I am not easily pleased when it comes to a camera which is under $100. Mind you that this is not an SLR but for something that is less than $100, it takes great pix. I haven't explored all the settings yet but just used IA mode and it takes awesome pix with just that mode if you don't want to experiment with all the settings. I have had it for 2 weeks and have taken pix in a club,zoo,and on a cloudy day and I have been pleased. The reason I am not giving it 5 stars because of battery life and the shutter lag which is a lot better than the first Panasonic I had and the Nikon coolpix but I still with it were faster.

Reviews.Title: Takes great pics !
Reviews.Author: Buckles
Reviews.Content: Haven't used it extensivly, but so far the camera seems great. Easy to use and the picture quality is amazing.

Reviews.Title: Love at 1st sight
Reviews.Author: G. Taylor "Busyscrapper"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a V-day gift for my 12 yo. She LOVES it!!! I haven't printed any pictures yet but I may have to pry it from her fingers while she sleeps. On screen the pics and videos look great. She is still reading the manual. Best $$$ spent.

Reviews.Title: OK camera, extremely slow zoom!
Reviews.Author: echrisa
Reviews.Content: This camera is good for a novice.  Picture clarity was good, although the zoom was painfully slow!  Too slow for me.  Unfortunately, had to return it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for a Great price
Reviews.Author: Jessica D Stilwell
Reviews.Content: This Camera is really good for the 89 dollars!  My old Olympus Stylus 600 wasn't reliable anymore so we invested in a new camera.  We have a Digital SLR so I really wanted something small for my person like the Olympus. This camera is going everything the Olympus was used for wonderfully :)  For the price I may even let the kids take a picture or two.  I did buy 4GB extra memory which is more than enough since the battery seems to least for about 300-350 picturesEditing my comment 1 week later as it is having problems coming out of sleep mode or when first turning on!  You can't seem to just turn it on and shoot it takes a few cycles of the lens going in and out...ANNOYING!  Love the pictures it takes and ease of use otherwise

Reviews.Title: nice tiny compact camera
Reviews.Author: wesbryn
Reviews.Content: Bought for teen age daughter...takes great pictures in low light...only thing we found wrong, it doesn't take action pictures..sporting pics...like wrestling...our High School gym is extremely dark...and the pictures are nice and light.. great for indoor pictures...paid $95.14 tax and Shipping...We rate this camera 9 out of 10. AWESOME picture quality for the price.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumic DMC-FH1
Reviews.Author: RNV-AZ
Reviews.Content: Got this camera for less than $100, for my wife's birthday. It fits easily in her purse, has a decent zoom, and takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic leaving others in the dust!!
Reviews.Author: Richard Brizendine
Reviews.Content: This is the third Panasonic Digital Camera we have owned in a varying price range, and we have loved all three of them. We have also had Nikon, Canon, Sony, Fuji and Pentax cameras, but none have been as reliable as Panasonic. GREAT pictures, features, ease of use, sturdiness, durability and looks. Panasonic continues to be a leader in almost everything they sell, just cant go wrong with this company or their products. Fine effort!!!

Reviews.Title: The best digital pocket camera I've owned.
Reviews.Author: Dennis Jefferson
Reviews.Content: I have a few Nikons because they are very nice cameras, but this Panasonic is a better camera for its intended use, a snapshot camera that I can use for all around photography, it is EASY to use and fast on the draw. I still use my more expensive Nikons for more creative work, but this one goes in my pocket more often. The lens is simply fantastic, fast and sharp. The programmed modes are fantastic, intuitive and easy to set. The battery is fantastic, lithium-ion, rechargeable, reliable and inexpensive.The only thing I can't comment on is this camera's longevity, I really like it and hope it stays with me a long time.

Reviews.Title: Good quality, affordable point and shoot
Reviews.Author: tim Brown
Reviews.Content: Bought as Christmas gift.  Kids used all holiday.  Stabilization mode produces clear images.  Intuitive menu was easy, even for ten year old.  Plenty of camera features and modes for them to create great results.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: Guido Linares
Reviews.Content: The Panasonic lumix DMC-FH1 camera excellent and have color blue electric that is beautiful. Pictures and videos of quality very good!!!Conclusion: Excellent camera for a very good price...

Reviews.Title: This is a great little camera!!
Reviews.Author: R. Horsley
Reviews.Content: This camera is a Christmas gift from my husband.  I was wanting to replace my 5-year old Sony Cybershot that still works great but has serious shutter lag issues. We have a young son and 2 dogs and shutter speed was a crucial issue in selecting a new model. There is nothing worse than setting up the perfect shot, then missing it because someone moves before the shutter snaps. I just got the Panasonic out of the box a couple hours ago, charged the battery, and off I went. I was thrilled with how easy it was to use right away, how quickly it boots up after turning on the power, and shutter lag is a thing of the past! Plus it is very compact and the blue color is vey striking.  I haven't uploaded yet to my computer and while i don't expect any kind of hassles I'll report back if i discover anything that would be a deal breaker.  My recommendation for this camera so far is BUY BUY BUY!

ProductInfo.Features:
Features 12.1-megapixel effective recording
Features 5X optical zoom
Features 2-11/16-Inch LCD screen
Optical image stabilization
Wide-angle lens for shooting landscapes and large groups
ProductInfo.Name: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FH1 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Blue)
